edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151

Enum Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Game>
      • edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Game>

    public enum Game
extends java.lang.Enum<Game>
    The Game class contains the core logic for our simulation. It has three states: Initializing, Running, Finishing During Initialization, the Game will:
    • Configure the board
    • Configure ghosts
    • Configure the target
    After a call to Run(), the Game will enter Running state, which loops repeatedly until a Ghost reports that the target is acquired. One loop will:
    • Instruct Ghosts to Move
    • Instruct Ghosts to Scan
    • Instruct Ghosts to Communicate
    • Render the Board
    After the target is acquired, the Game will enter the Finishing state, where it will:
    • Print the game statistics
    • Exit the game

      • ConfigureBoard

        public void ConfigureBoard(int numberOfGhosts,
                  java.util.Random generator)
        Initializes the main game board, creates the specified number of Ghosts and places them on the board, and also creates and places the target.
        Parameters:
        numberOfGhosts - The number of ghosts to place on the board
        generator - A Random generator used for placing the ghosts/target on the board

      • Run

        public void Run(int numberOfGhosts)
        Runs the simulation with the given number of ghosts
        Parameters:
        numberOfGhosts - number of ghosts that will work to find the target

      • Update

        public void Update()
        Let the ghosts move, scan their surroundings, and communicate. If any ghost finds the target, return right away and set a flag so that we can terminate
